entities: Security Council Committee established pursuant to resolution 1591 (2005) concerning the Sudan
summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions on Sudan, determines that the situation in Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security. 
The Council, acting under Chapter VII, recalls measures imposed on Sudan, including arms embargo and travel bans, and reaffirms provisions related to these measures. 
The Council extends the mandate of the Panel of Experts until 12 March 2020, and requests the Panel to provide an interim report by 12 August 2019 and a final report by 13 January 2020. 
The Panel is also requested to provide updates every three months to the Committee. 
The Council intends to review the mandate and take action regarding its extension by 12 February 2020. 
The Council also intends to regularly review measures on Darfur, taking note of the Committee Chair's report and the Panel's reports, and to establish clear benchmarks to guide its review of measures on the Government of Sudan. 
The Council decides to remain seized of the matter.
